review.reviewBody: Awesome fit and very lightweight
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody: The fit of the ski helmet is fantastic – snug and secure without being uncomfortable. I get extra 15% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Very pleased with this.

review.reviewBody:
Overall very comfortable helmet, sits just a little higher than another helmet I tried, but not too bad really so you don't look like a mushroom head. Deal breaker for me was the goggle fit. The Anon M4 goggles doesn't fit well with this helmet, no pictures since I already returned it. The goggles stick out past the brim of the helmet and the helmet pushes the goggles down your face a little, pinching your nose, making it a little harder to breathe. It's unfortunate, got a great price during the holidays and it truly is one of the more comfortable helmets I've ever tried on. Definitely a huge upgrade from the last model Mod5.

Basically I would recommend bringing your goggles to see if they fit. The M4 are huge, so it may just be them. But I'm not buying new goggles for a helmet since I bought my goggles at the end of last season. Someone might have better luck if they have Oakley goggles.
review.name: Nice Helmet

review.reviewBody: I have the Oakley MOD 5 size M  but I wanted to upgrade to one with MIPS. I was totally surprised when I received the new helmet and it didn't fit me! The helmet was narrower than the old model, so I had to return it.
review.name: The helmet is smaller than the MOD 5

name: Mod5 Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite pair of hiking pants I have ever had. The material is light enough to hike in the summer and very flexible fabric eliminates any catching, twisting, and rubbing that I have had with other pants. They are a little more of slim cut which I defiantly prefer and the built in belt has worked great so far. Highly recommend these for hiking!
review.name: My favorite hiking pants

review.reviewBody: Normally Patagonia is great, but not these pants. No zippers at the ankle and no scuff guards at all for crampon protection. Material isn?t any thicker on the backside or knees. No tie-in points to make your own under-boot gaiter. I?m not sure these are much better than some cheap soft shells from a non-climbing company. Sorry to say it, but I?ll stick with Rab or Arcteryx.
review.name: Patagonia is great, but not these pants
comment: Sorry these didn't work for you, Josh.  Appreciate the helpful feedback as it's important to find a product that has features that work well for where and how they'll be used.  A burlier pant with additional features may work best for your mountaineering excursions. Thanks again for the comments.

name: Altvia Alpine Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
These were the first rocking climbing shoes I used.  so far i have used it a little over a month now. one thing i have to say is. I love it !

here are the pro and con

Pro
1): it stands out.
2): perfect fit as it ajust after a few days of using. 
3): perfect for climbing in all aspects (in my opinion because it's my first shoes.) 

Con
1): got a blister on my big toe after the first time. (my toe got used to it, no more blister :) )
2): my toes have to curl a little when walking around. (got used to it)
review.name: Best one more beginners to intermedia

review.reviewBody: I've used a pair of these while climbing across Europe - in the French Alps, Swiss limestone, and Finland's short granite. They gone up trad routes up to 25 pitches (Le Soleil Rendezvous Avec la Lune) and sport climbs up to 5.13b. Recently I've been taking them back to the Chamonix cliffs on Red Pillar on up to 10 pitch routes, and up to 6b+. It may not be the best bouldering shoe for anyone, but I really love the look and comfort of these from Mad Rock. Definitely a great shoe for the price, as well. I like to call them the Wes Anderson shoe of crack climbing because of the color. They did stretch a little over the year that I used them, but they are still my go-to for comfort on long crack climbs.
review.name: Great trad shoe

review.reviewBody:
I never write reviews but I had such a hard time finding sizing info on this so here we go.

Most of my climbing these days is training on long traverses and trad. Also, I have an old foot injury that acts up when I spend too much time on micro edges with mocs and other thin shoes, so I wanted a stiff shoe. Honestly I needed something for trad while I resole my favorite shoes, TC Pros.

Just climbed about 600? in them and jammed in a roof crack and I?m sold on them, especially for the price. 

Comfortable out of the box, stiff enough for my toe to not hurt after standing on 1/4? edges, jammed great and painless even upside down.
They even look hip and retro!

I am a 10 street shoe no matter brand: Nike, Birkenstock, etc

Sizing:
I size aggressively but not into pain or curled toes 
TC Pro 9
Mocassym 9
Phoenix 9.5 so half size down. 
Tried a 10 and a 9 and the 10 had too much room (no contact between toe and end)  when I pointed my foot and the 9 was excruciating

For reference I?ve climbed 8 years
review.name: Excellent budget trad shoe

review.reviewBody:
This is a great shoe for the intermediate climber, and excellent value as well.  The sole is quite stiff allowing for excellent edging and takes a lot of stress of your feet when climbing for long periods.  It's also surprisingly comfortable.  After you get used to it, you'll really start trusting your feet even on very small footholds.

One tradeoff: being stiffer than most beginner shoes, you will lose some sensitivity in "feeling" for holds with your feet.  This is minor, however, and well worth the trade off as you are moving into the intermediate grades.

Sizing: I wear a size 10.5 street shoe and sized up to a 11.5.  A 10.5 was far too small.  An 11 probably would have worked for an "aggressive fit," but I prefer not to be taking my shoes on and off all the time at the crag.  An 11.5 was perfect for me: very comfortable, but still tight enough to be very effective.
review.name: Excellent Intermediate Shoe

review.reviewBody: True to size, used several times already and loved it!
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Good for edging, fits my wife foot well, stiff, very comfortable, awesome value.
review.name: They?re great

name: Phoenix Climbing Shoe

hasVariant.name: Drink Mix
hasVariant.description: Buy the Formula 369 Drink Mix online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
You truly can't beat the price:performance ratio of Formula 369. Simple, easy on the GI system, customizable for length and intensity of rides, hydration built into it.

It has a neutral sweet flavor that you can affect by adding some citrus juice or whatever you want.

Work this into your fueling approach and be happy knowing you've got simple, affordable ingredients going in.

I do a single scoop in a standard bottle for quick morning/afternoon rides, then get specific and do more scoops paired with gels and real food for longer/harder efforts.

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: Formula 369 Is What's Up

review.reviewBody: exactly what you need to fuel properly has helped me on longer rides! dilutes great in your water bottle with a pleasant mild sweet flavor to it.
review.name: Works Great!

review.reviewBody: You won’t find a better fueling solution for the money. I recommend it to everyone and most of my riding buddies have jumped on the band wagon with me. I love how flexible and simple it is to customize your carb intake for your needs. I use 2 scoops per bottle for short or lower intensity rides and 3-3.5 scoops for longer or higher intensity rides. The flavor is clean and neutral and not as sweet as you might expect considering it is basically 99.9% sugar. I like to add a splash of lemon juice to my bottles. Try it. You won’t regret it.
review.name: I love formula 369!

review.reviewBody: Got this mix based off simplicity and lack of other “stuff.” I read multiple reviews of how it has no taste. I really didn’t know what to expect but when you drink it it does have sweetness, not taste. It’s good and simple and does the trick. I think I’ll be using this for a while and maybe add some lemon juice or something if I do want any taste.
review.name: Sweetness, not taste

review.reviewBody:
As a CrossCountry MTB cyclist I have a very sensitive stomach and virtually all big brands drink mixes and gels I’ve tried have made me puke during all marathon and endurance(3-6hrs) races due to how heavy they are with fillers. 
Formula 369 dissolves extremely well in the bottle. I went from a drink mix, electrolyte bottle and gels to just Formula 369 for training and races and I could not be happier. Very smooth with mild non overpowering flavor at a great price. Better fueling allows me to hold higher avg watts comfortably which returns better results. I can focus on riding and not worry if I’m gonna puke or get stomach cramps and have to back off.
review.name: Love it, great product

review.reviewBody: You can't beat Formula 369. The mix is perfect and doesn't upset my stomach. 90% of the high carb mixes out there destroy my gut. This bag is massive! Price per serving is the lowest you'll find. My rides average 40-50 miles and I always bring at least one bottle with Formula 369. Personally one or two scoops is sufficient for my rides, but if you're racing definitely do three scoops!! There is no flavor, so add your own if that's important to you. I think the flavoring may be one of the things that triggers my gut issues, so I appreciate the simplicity of this mix. Post ride you can mix in some protein powder and your body will thank you :) At the end of the day this mix is an optimal combination of sugar, salt and carbs. It mixes great and there are no clumps. The company owner is an endurance athlete and has tons of informational videos on their various social media channels. I'm huge on supporting small businesses based in the USA and Formula 369 checks all the boxes. Great product, great value, great company.
review.name: Great Product, Value, Company

review.reviewBody: This is all I drink these days; the product is excellent with a slight flavoring that is drinkable for 5+ hours. The price point is also right there compared to other options
review.name: Love Formula 369

name: Drink Mix

review.reviewBody: I purchased these 2 weeks ago and one look and try on I knew I had a top tier flat pedal shoe for all conditions. From the perfect fit and easy lacing system to the elastic around the ankles to keep your feet dry and clean. I own a pair of Shimano GR9 flat pedals shoes which have been the best pair of shoes I’ve owned on flat pedals. The GFX 800 looks like and definitely feels like it will be my go to pedals for all conditions.One ride and I’m convinced, waterproof, plenty warm and super sticky on my pedals. They also clean right up after a day of hard riding. Highly recommend the shoes if you ride with flat pedals you can’t go wrong.
review.name: Versatile all weather flat pedal shoe.

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe since it’s often wet in the east coast. It’s performs exceptionally well in wet and dry conditions and I have found that it was not too hot on 20-35 mile rides even in the mid 80’s
review.name: Great waterproof shoe

review.reviewBody: These boots are perfect for barn chores. They easily hose clean after stomping around in the muck and mire.
review.name: Best Boots

review.reviewBody: There's some sort of outer coating that is "sweating" down the boot. It's also causing a smell. Love the style, design and comfort.
review.name: Great design; potential chemical mfg issue

review.reviewBody: I love my salmon sisters XTRATUFF boots so much! I bought a pair for my daughter who got a job in Alaska for the summer. I loved hers so much, I bought a pair for myself.
review.name: Happy camper!

review.reviewBody: XtraTuf boots used to be top of the line, best of the best, none better anywhere boots. Since the original small company was sold to a larger company, quality issues are now the norm. I've had a brand new pair lose the printed cloth lining at the heel within 5 days of use, another brand new pair arrived with twine hanging out the back of both heels, and another brand new pair began leaking through the soles within 2 weeks of use. For reference, my very first pair of XtraTuf boots is over 7 years old and has 0 of these issues, still to this day. This gross drop in quality is devastating for those of us who relied on XtraTuf for commercial grade, high quality workwear that would stand up to the job. These are now nothing more than a fashion statement and should only be purchased with style in mind. What a loss.
review.name: Quality Issues
comment:
Hello Emily,
 Please reach out if you need assistance.  We want to make sure you are 100% satisfied with your purchase!  We appreciate your support.
xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: I finally bought a pair about a month ago. They are beautiful and sturdy. They run a bit small imo. I generally wear a 7.5, bought an 8 thinking they would accommodate thick socks, but my big toe just felt smashed against the end. Returned them (super easy!) for a 9 and they were perfect!
review.name: Beautiful and sturdy!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these boots! Heavy duty protection, plus extremely comfortable. And cute colors!
review.name: Best rain boots for mud

review.reviewBody: I use these boots for everything....all year long. Best purchase ever!!!
review.name: Best boots ever!!!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. I popped a pair of Superfeet insoles in them to make the extra comfortable. Living in the Pacific Northwest, these are my everyday footwear for most of the year. Thanks XtraTuf for making awesome, functional boots!
review.name: On my feet right now

review.reviewBody:
I got these a few months back because they’re so cute, but they are wildly comfortable for rubber boots too! I’ll wear these things anywhere with anything lol

Most bold combo has been short spandex shorts, these boots, and an oversized sweatshirt to the grocery store lol
review.name: New Favorite Pair of Shoes!

review.reviewBody: Amazing boots! Even keep my feet warm when walking through melted snow. Comfortable, cute & great for multipurpose
review.name: Love these boots!

description: Buy the Backcountry 3/4-Sleeve Enduro Jersey - Past Season - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 3/4-Sleeve Enduro Jersey - Past Season - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry 3/4-Sleeve Enduro Jersey - Past Season - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my first 3/4 length sleeve jersey for biking, and I'm mostly a convert.  Fit is on the looser side but not so baggy that I felt like I needed to size down.  Relaxed fit means no storage pockets like on road jerseys, so you need somewhere else to carry a repair kit. Material is slightly on the thicker side but very soft and breathes surprisingly well.  Would choose other kit for temps >80*F.
review.name: Great shoulder season jersey

review.reviewBody: Grabbed this for Fall riding and have been impressed with the fit and finish. Medium fits my 5’10 160lb frame well. Big fan of BC branded stuff.
review.name: Super Nice

review.reviewBody: This jersey is perfect for all but the hottest rides. The elbow protection is super nice for bike park laps, and I use the hem-integrated optics wipe all the time. The fit is pretty comparable to other gravity-oriented jerseys across the industry with a true regular fit. The drop tail hem is nice for me as a tall and skinny guy and provides a great on-the-bike fit.
review.name: Daily driver

review.reviewBody: Nice fit, true to size, looks good and is comfortable. Great value from Back Country. Will buy another.
review.name: Great Jersey

review.reviewBody:
I just purchased the Backcountry SS and 3/4 sleeve MTB Jerseys. At first impression, the quality of the materials are on par with competing brand jerseys such as TLD and Fox. So, this jersey gives great value. Designs are subtle and finish are excellent. I have yet to test one out but from my experience with MTB jerseys, I can tell these are made to last and perform as described. 

Fitting. I am in between sizes "small" and "medium" and required the assistance of a Gearhead. Lexi was very helpful and suggested a medium, and if it didn't fit, she offered me free shipping for the return. Both sizes fit me. However, I went with the size small for a more "athletic" fit and I still had room in the jersey. If you want a roomier fit and/or will be using body armor, then a medium would be better. Ultimately, the size small suited me better.  I am 5'9', 155 lbs. Chest 37.5" Waist 32"

Lastly, Size small jersey measures 20" in width and 28 3/4" in length from top of the back collar. Size medium jersey measures 21" in width and 30 1/4" in length.

Hope this helps! 

To Backcountry: Please make a long sleeve MTB jersey!!
review.name: Awesome Backcountry branded MTB jersey

name: 3/4-Sleeve Enduro Jersey - Past Season - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I have bought these shoes for 10 years. This year they changed the drop from 6mm to 8mm and made the show “cushy” like Hoka. This ruined the shoe for me and actually has my knee hurting a bit while running. I’m only 30 years old. 

Changing the drop on a shoe is a huge deal, as that is what makes the shoe consistent for return buyers.  If the 16 felt good for you, this 17 might not. As in the past you could consistently purchase the shoe year after year and receive that familiar supper comfort on your run with the stiff sole and 6mm droop. 

Why change a good thing ? This shoe was so good because it stuck to the tried and true form supporting feel.

If we want a Hoka we could go buy a Hoka. 

I hope they bring it back to their bread and butter like the guide 14 next year.
review.name: Disappointing Changes

review.reviewBody: Some of the best most comfortable shoes I have ever owned
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: Great training shoe for long easy runs.  I use this shoe for slow easy runs and the Saucony  Endorphin Speed 4 for speed work and race day. Love both!!
review.name: Saucony are the Best!!

review.reviewBody: These shoea are excellent for my osteoarthritis. I wear these for work and the shoes provide all day comfort. As a 6’5” 300 pounder I would recommend these shoes.
review.name: Orthopedic Approved

review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes on 8/15/2024 and have put 215 miles on them since then (I track my running shoes pretty closely). I usually expect my shoes to hold up at least 250 to 300 miles and the first 150 miles were in these were great - comfortable and supportive. Now at 215 miles, these shoes have had their tread completely ground off and look like they've had more miles on them than they actually do. Saucony's products, as a whole, has continued to go down hill in terms of quality.
review.name: Not Built For Longevity

review.reviewBody:
The shoe was purchased as a warranty in kind replacement. 
The initial wear of the shoe has been nothing but fantastic but more importantly the dedication of the company to its customers and follow through in the craftsmanship of the product has been especially great!
review.name: Saucony for life!

review.reviewBody: My favorite pair of distance shoes, yet. Totally responsive and comfortable
review.name: WOW
comment: Thanks for the stellar review, Charles!

review.reviewBody:
A great all around shoe
- light
- great rocker
- holds the foot in place
review.name: Guide 17 - Fantastic Running Shoe

review.reviewBody: Have ordered a few of these already. Love them. Comfortable and durable
review.name: Great Shoe!

review.reviewBody: I bought these about a month ago. At first, I experienced some knee pain, but after a break-in period of about 50 miles, the shoes feel perfect. They have the perfect amount of cushioning for road runs and work well on light trails too. Good traction and non-intrusive support. The Guide 15-16 were my favorite shoes, but the 17 is even better.
review.name: My favorite Saucony

name: Guide 17 Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This was my 2nd pair of this same trail shoe.  I was glad it was still available since it's my favorite trail shoe.  I used it to run Machu Picchu marathon. The Inca trail has hundreds of thousands of step and stones all different sizes, so the toe guard was important to me. I also need a wide toe box. This shoe has plenty of tread and I got a lot of wear out of them. I wish they would continue to make this very shoe forever, and in this beautiful color! (Note, my previous shoe was a 8.5, but since it wasn't available I had to purchase a 9 this time and intend to keep them.)
review.name: Best Trail Shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I saw these on the website and I loved their styling, ordered a 9 ( my regular size) European size 40.5. Unfortunately I couldn’t  break them in, they seemed too short. I sent them back and ordered a European size 41 (us size 9.5) and they fit perfectly!! I am a garden center nursery manager and need a pair of shoes that are tuff & comfortable. I may buy another pair  in the blue for my personal time.
review.name: Great Walking/Hiking Shoes!!

review.reviewBody: As expected, another great jacket from 686. Just the right about of insulation for normal resort riding.
review.name: Quality Jacket

review.reviewBody: Really great design offering a ton of pockets to store your gear. The jacket fits lose on the body. The pink/white/grey pattern matches the rest of my gear.
review.name: Awesome snowboard jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket has a pocket for everything. It fits great and is an awesome jacket!
review.name: Awesome jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The colors are amazing. The coat is so warm. I love that the waist band stretches. There is absolutely room for layering (I am 5'4" and 135lbs). The longer fit is not too long - its perfect. This coat was so worth the money :)
review.name: Coat of my dreams

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The jacket is v light and comfortable. The color and pattern is great though the length a bit longer than I expected. Look forward to wearing it on the snow!
review.name: Light and comfortable jacket

review.reviewBody:
I love the pattern, length and warmth factor of this jacket, but that is where the love ends and the faulty design of the zippers leads me to give this jacket a low rating. All of the zippers catch which is incredibly inconvenient on the mountain. I often just give up trying to do the main zip up all the way past my collarbones, so end up spending the day with snow and cold air blowing in, and the collar flapping around me. The two breast pocket zips catch every time, and one is now completely stuck with fabric, so much so that if I try to pull it to fix it and do the zip up, I think I might tear the fabric. As another reviewer said, the double zip on the main zip of the jacket also comes up by itself, particularly when sitting on the lift, which again is very inconvenient. If you don't want to spend half the day wrenching at zippers, avoid this jacket!
Another feature which I found really disappointing is that there is no connection hole between the phone pocket and the rest of the jacket to accomodate headphone cords. I realise headphone cords are old-school but I think it's a bit premature to assume that everyone is happy to use easy-to-lose wireless headphones, especially while skiing or snowboarding. For me to listen to music with the phone in the designated phone pocket, I had to have the cord coming out of the zipper and sitting on the outside of my jacket in the elements. The only other option was to have the phone in the interior pocket and run the cord up through the jacket. But that meant if I wanted to look at my phone I had to unzip my jacket (see above comments about inability to be able to do zip back up!).
For the cost of this jacket I am incredibly disappointed, but at least I look good on the mountain I guess...
review.name: Faulty zipper design and other odd design features not well thought through

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket! It has so many features, it’s warm, and I get lots of compliments on the pattern.
review.name: I love this jacket! It

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so lightweight yet it keeps me warm and dry. I’m 4”11 and weigh 120 lbs and got a size S with lots of rooms to layer up. Relaxed fit and length is perfect for my liking. Would recommend this to my friends!!
review.name: This jacket is so lightweight

review.reviewBody: It's a little baggy but that is perfect for being on the mountain and having extra clothes underneath. I was actually worried that the Medium would be too small/tight and that I would need to get a Large (I normally wear size M tops/clothes) but the fit was great. Not too small/big and still have me plenty of movement.
review.name: Perfect Baggy Fit

review.reviewBody:
There are many thing to love about this jacket, and just a couple that are incredibly annoying. I constantly get compliments on the color- it is gorgeous. The fit is great, long enough to cover my backside and give me an extra layer when sitting in the lift. 
The problems most come with the zippers. I love the double zipper on the main zipper which allows for greater range of motion in my hips, but it does come up all on its own and continues to creep up so I occasionally have to pull the bottom zipper down. The zipper in the “insulated cell phone pocket” (which is the chest pocket on the left hand side of the jacket) constantly gets stuck on the fabric inside the pocket. This makes it mostly useless because I can’t trust I will be able to get my phone out. Once the zipper was stuck for a full day on the slopes. Other zippers also get caught, none as much as this one. I have given up using this pocket all together because my family needs to be able to get ahold of me when we are all out on the mountain. It is a shame because it is a good spot for a phone and nice and deep enough that the phone doesn’t press against my chest. If that pocket/zipper could be fixed I would give the coat 5 stars.
review.name: Great look, zippers leave a lot to be desired

name: Mantra Insulated Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I've worn quite a few helmets, and this one seems to fit my head the best both from an actual "it fits my headshape" and not having the "mushroom" look. I have a large noggin and that's tough to do! I'm currently wearing the L/XL size with the retention system right in the middle of the height adjustment. Normally I need the retention system to be lower on helmets, but in this case of actually having the ability to change it, it's already where it should be!
The removable, and adjustable visor/peak does a great job or staying where I want it and giving enough coverage without obstructing my view. I tried out the mount and it feels super solid! I'll probably only ever mount a light there though. I haven't tried wearing it with goggles yet, but the rubber pad and the contours of the helmet look like they would keep everything in place. The Koroyd is neat and keeps the bees and other bugs out. For me, the Koroyd is a bit less breezy as other helmets with completely open vents, but it still does a great job. I just might not be wearing it in the middle of TX summers. For the other 9 months of the year though, I think this might be my new favorite! 
I'd like to see a fidloc buckle, but that's a minor critique on an otherwise fantastic helmet!
review.name: Great looking, feature packed Trail Lid!

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this helmet. The shape and fit is super comfortable and the ratchet strap makes for an easy perfect fit. The mount on top for lights and gopros is also very clutch and has made night riding a lot more accessible. The venting and the visor are also well constructed and well thought out. Overall, 5 stars on the MT500. I would recommend this for anyone looking for a perfect trail helmet!
review.name: Great helmet!

review.reviewBody: As someone who runs hot and sweats too much no matter how minimal I dress, helmets have been a necessary evil in my experience. So to start out I'll comment on how great the ventilation is. The padding itself doesn't seem to trap much heat either. I rode in Phoenix last week when temps were approaching 100 and it vented great. The adjustments allow for more precision when dialing in the fit. I was hesitant on which size to go with since my head is about 59cm around. I chose the M/L but I think if I did it over again I would size up. The "Y" in the chin straps barely fit below my ears and I believe a size larger would fix that issue. Regardless, everything else about the helmet is fantastic!
review.name: Great Helmet

review.reviewBody: Really impressed with the quality and comfort from Endura with the new MT500. The retention system is easily adjustable on the fly. It also has three different height adjustments to dial in the fit for a variety of people. I am a huge fan of the padding in this helmet, it is some of the best I've seen/felt! I was hesitant about how the 3D Koroyd might impact ventilation. To my surprise, the helmet vents extremely well. Over all, I am a huge fan - I grab this helmet without hesitation anytime I leave my garage for a trail ride!
review.name: Great Trail Helmet!

review.reviewBody:
Couldn't ask for a better fit! 

I have a dead on 54.5cm slightly oval noggin and the Endura MT500 in a S-M fits without having to squish my head in, or size up to a medium. 

The Visor is one of the burliest designs I have seen in a minute, very firm clicks moving it up or down and it holds its place. Helmet still looks clean with the visor removed.

The micro adjust dial in the back gives me every bit of fine tuning I could want. 

Ventilation is on point, and the helmet feels bombproof while still being lightweight with the full Koroyd construction (thoroughly tested it on some low lying branches that jumped out in the trail) 

One of the best bits would have to be the included Gopro/ light mount. It's one of the sturdiest solutions I have seen to mounting a device on a helmet, and super unobtrusive. I leave mine on even when I'm not using it, the mount may or may not have also caught that aforementioned branch hard with no visible effect. 

I own a helmet or two, or six, and this is currently my favorite for hitting the trail.
review.name: My New Daily Helmet.

name: MT500 Mips Helmet
MT500 Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody:
Good for the sale price of $30. Cute warm and fashionable. I like how it's *slightly* cropped and it cinches at the waist - sleeves just a bit big!

5'4" 140 lbs size medium works well. Maybe could have done a small if available
review.name: Almost great

review.reviewBody:
Really liked this jacket but I am a true size small and this was too tight.  Also this is short.  
Because of this had to return.  I think the next size up might be too roomy so did not do an exchange. If this fits someone would be a great jacket so giving it four stars
review.name: Cute jacket but runs small

review.reviewBody: Loved this jacket!  Bought on a whim and didn't regret it.  Very comfortable and well priced.
review.name: Shannon

review.reviewBody: I am so happy I chose to order this jacket! It is so comfortable & very true to size.
review.name: I am obsessed with this jacket!

review.reviewBody: I love the retro color block and quilting, but the fit was too far off for me to keep it. The jacket itself is quite short and the sleeves cover my hands completely. It's thicker (and probably warmer) than I thought, which overall is a plus. I'm sure it would be super cute on the right person. An extra small would have been too tight around the shoulders.
review.name: Close but not quite

review.reviewBody: This jacket might be Stoic's best yet. I normally wear a small, but I sized up to a medium for a couple reasons. First, I like to have a little extra room in my jackets for the extra-cold big-sweater days. Second, let's face it, Backcountry and Stoic have a tendency to run in the small direction. But this jacket's fit is TRUE. A bit baggy in the shoulders, but I'm sure that's due to being a size too large. The fabric is soft, but doesn't feel flimsy, and I was nice and warm camping in 50-60 degree temperatures.
review.name: Stoic with the W

review.reviewBody: Has some great features. It’s very adjustable and I like the diagonal zipper. Unfortunately, I struggled to keep the shoulder straps tucked. There is a lot of extra fabric on the sides. I kept trying to either tuck it und the side straps or just let it stick out. I’ve had it out on 1 trip, so still figuring it all out.
review.name: Plenty of room to adjust to plus size

review.reviewBody: I’m a dragonboater. My Layla PFD’s armholes are cut such that they do not interfere with my stroke at all. The off-set zipper and women’s cut lets it fit perfectly around my torso. I also like that Astral is responsibly environmental in their material selection.
review.name: Very comfy

review.reviewBody: If you like a high-waisted shorter torso jacket this is for you. Simply letting the shoulder straps out does not make it fit properly.  If you like longer belly coverage, don't get it.  The velcro zipper cover is cheap and loose. It does not prevent the zipper from pulling down.  A better design would be to put a neoprene or nylon pocket for the zipper pull to insert into.  The jacket itself is comfortable, and the front pocket large size is nice.
review.name: Astral Layla and the Average/Long Waist Girl

review.reviewBody: I love the color and fit.  The pockets are accessible and worthy!
review.name: Kayaking and SUP

review.reviewBody: I’ve used my Layla 3 times now. I’ve found it to be quite comfortable and easy to put on/take off. I love how adjustable it is to make it conform to my body, and the pocket in the front is super convenient, whether I use it for snacks or holding my phone! Can’t wait to use it even more!!
review.name: Comfortable and form fitting!

review.reviewBody: Excellent choice for a PFD! I bought this for my wife and she loves the fit, look, and durability. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great choice!

review.reviewBody: I bought mine two years ago and I love it so much, I've used and tried on quite a few PFD's as I work at a sporting goods store and this one has been my favorite. The fit is the best I have ever had out of all the PFD's. It is very comfortable and has a great range of motion while still feeling secure. The materials are super soft and comfortable while still being durable. I've had mine for two years and have seen no signs of damage or significant wear. The knife clip is in an inconvenient spot but if I paddle correctly it's not an issue. Overall this PFD is one of the best choices for any female paddler looking for a comfy vest for paddling!
review.name: My Personal Favorite PFD!

review.reviewBody: This life jacket is exactly what I’ve been looking for. As someone with a larger chest, I love all the adjustable straps and flexible materials, it helps you get the perfect fit. I’m not the strongest swimmer so this gives me so much more confidence out on the water. Highly recommend this one!
review.name: Finally found one that fits!

review.reviewBody: Don’t love it. Rides up when floating. Can’t seem to get it cinched enough to not do this. Is comfortable though.
review.name: Comfortable but rides up when floating

review.reviewBody: The Layla jacket fits great. The pocket is perfectly located and going over the head is not as hard as I thought it would be.
review.name: Layla Jacket.

review.reviewBody:
Imagine leaving a bad review for a tire after you had payment issues… Anyway. Please don’t let bad average rating of this tire (cause of that nonsensical review) fool you. There’s a noticeable difference in rolling resistance and suppleness between this tire and regular 5000 s tr. Regulars are already arguably the best balance tire out there but these have taken it another step.

My only complaint would be that they wear fast. I’m at 2500 miles. I swapped front < > back around 2000 miles and got another 3 weeks / 500 miles out of them. After today’s ride, they literally don’t have another ride in them. Completely warn to the indicators and rear isn’t able to hold air. 

I say for the extra performance benefit, 2500 miles is pretty friggin good. Save these for race season and go with gp 5000 s tr or s tr as (for better grip too in the wet) for training.
review.name: Best rolling and one of the most supple

review.reviewBody: I made two simultaneous purchases, one was approved by my credit card, the other told me that for security reasons I had to verify six digits of my bank. Your customer service agent did not have the patience and his suggestion was to cancel the order to which I agreed to cancel both orders. End of the story.
review.name: Bad shopping experience

name: Grand Prix 5000 TT Tubeless Tire

review.reviewBody: Apparently this pant is for "casual lounging" only, a piece of info I certainly missed while searching for actual work clothing that accommodate women's bodies. Yet again just another pair of pants with knee pad inserts and no possible way to use a knee pad because their skinny jeans. Clearly I made some mistakes on my part in the pair that I ordered, however i'm thoroughly disappointed nonetheless. This clothing is supposed to be for working in, no one it buying this kind of thing to casually lounge in. The pants fit well/ as expected in the waist (unlike Carhartts marketed to women) but they are NOT for working in, they are also not for casual lounging, because again, who wants to lounge in skinny jeans with a knee pad that doesn't fit??? If I had put knee pads in these pants I wouldn't be able to get them back on over my legs, that = NONFUNCTIONAL. Luckily this is no new issue as i'm sure many women in the trades know, and similarly to how i've altered other pants in the past, I cut them open and sewed in an extra 4" to each leg. 4" was essentially the minimum amount of fabric needed to make this clothing item functional. They fit great in the waist and I now enjoy wearing them as work pants, but $100 is way to much to spend on clothes that require alterations to be usable. Not to mention the knee pads land in a bad spot, almost missing my knees completely during use, requiring lots of adjusting and mostly cover my thighs. Needless to say, these pants were poorly designed, poorly thought out and incorrectly marketed. An extremely off putting experience with a clothing brand supposedly for women in the trades. Additionally it appears as though Dovetail only offers pants with working knee pads for women in clothing materials I'm not interested in, as stretchy synthetic fabric neither holds up as well or functions as well as canvas. It looks to me, that just like Duluth, Dovetail makes work clothes for women as long as the toughest work they see is in the garden... I don't work in a garden Dovetail. Do better.
review.name: Maven X Pant - Womens... Not Impressed

review.reviewBody: Every single time I wear these pants i get compliments and asked where i got them.
review.name: compliments all the time

name: Maven X Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: For a long time I wanted to change the chainring on my bike, it came with a 32 chainring and I found it too small for my taste. I have a 36 on my other bike so I decided to go with the 34t. I know my way around the bike so the only special tool needed is the LTR-4 in order to take out the lockring, be aware that you also need a vise or 36mm wrench and a torque tool. I don't mind getting new tools for specific jobs, but we are not all the same. It took ne about between 30-45 minutes for the complete install. The bike looks great and feels great, those extra 2 tooth really makes a difference.
review.name: I needed 2 more tooth.

review.reviewBody:
You need a special tool to install this on the crank arm, either Park Tool LRT-4 - Shimano Direct Mount Lockring Tool or Shimano TL-FC41 DM Chainring Installation Tool.  Neither of which is common enough for any local bike shop to stock.  This should be called out in the description.  The manuals for this ring cover bottom bracket installation and crank-to-bike installation, but say nothing about installing the chainring on the crank arm.

This is actually the 3rd "special" tool needed to install new BB-MT800 bottom bracket, FC-M7120 SLX crankset, and this chainring.  First you need a special bottom bracket tool which used to be included with the BB-MT800 bb but either isn't anymore or I got a bb with missing pieces.  Then you need the tool I mentioned above.  And finally you need another small plastic tool to install/remove the cap on the non-drive side.  Shimano should be ashamed of themselves, there are plenty of other crankset manufacturers that only require one special tool, rather than 3.  This is likely the last shimano crankset I'll ever install.

It's also heavy.  It's weird that it is a 2-piece chainring where virtually every other manufacturer just uses a single piece.  The chainring itself feels really heavy compared to every other one (from other brands) I've ever installed.  The weight feels like it's the center piece rather than the ring.
review.name: special tool required, heavy
comment:
Hi Brian, 
Sorry to hear your frustration with the Shimano chainring.  Feel free to chat in, or call next time.  We can look into some tool requirements with you.  Our experts are here to help, call us and we will take care of you.1-888-276-7130

name: SLX SM-CRM75 Direct-Mount Chainring

hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Dry Creek Rolltop Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic pack! The only issue I see is size options. Maybe another size bigger.

It broke on Day1. The straps are glued, not stitched to the bag. I literally picked it up off the ground and the entire strap ripped off while I was at the airport waiting to leave on my fishing trip!  It was the first day I used this backpack.  My dad had the exact same thing happen in the first week he used it!  A guide on our fishing trip also had the same back with a broken strap in the same place!  The bag would be awesome if the straps stayed attached!  I love the rollmop feature and the size of the bag!
review.name: Poor strap design

review.reviewBody: I couldn't be more disappointed by this bag.  When I received the bag one of the seams was not glued, instead of paying to send the BRAND NEW bag in I chose to fix it myself. The fix worked and sealed the bag but about a month later the shoulder strap started to rip off and its unfixable. In theory this is a great bag, water bottle holder, external storage, and even a little back padding, but in reality this pack has some seriously major manufacturing flaws.
review.name: Open seam and broken shoulder strap

review.reviewBody: I had high hopes for this backpack as the medium size and weight were perfect for how I like to fish. Unfortunately the main shoulder strap detached from the pack on my first day of travel. I hadn’t used the backpack so not sure if this was a one off defect. This occurred at the beginning of a week long remote trip to Alaska so I had to find a way to reattach the strap with  stitching. Bummer.
review.name: Main Strap detached on day 1

review.reviewBody: Love the bag so far, does everything I need it to and works great for river trips.
review.name: Great bag, love it

review.reviewBody: Great bag with a ton of space at a great price point
review.name: Dry Creek Bag

review.reviewBody: Seems exactly as advertised. I bought it for my self bailing raft as the floor is often wet.
Times up. Was really looking forward to this product being available, but the wait has been in excess of a couple months. I will look elsewhere for my dry bag needs.
review.name: Availability?

name: Dry Creek Rolltop Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got this for my camping quilt and it’ll hold a whole lot more too, now I have to rethink my packing…😄
review.name: Works great and holds a lot more than I thought

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these sack to keep everything organized in my pack
review.name: Compression sacks

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really happy with my 20 Liter compression sack. I use it for travel packing.
It compressed my clothes with minimal effort and minimal wrinkled garments. Very easy to use and sturdy. I definitely recommend this and my brother-in-law bought two based on my suggestion!
See my 'before' and 'after' pictures!!
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this compression sack it has lasted me a while and I have used this same still for upwards of 2 years and I love it, it is the best combination of lightweight without sacrificing durability along the way.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased one of each of these packs for my daughter and son in law for Christmas because they are frequent travelers who like to contain their luggage to carry ons and a backpack each, especially when traveling internationally. They also go skiing a couple times a year and on that trip they have to pack very bulky jackets, ski pants, sweaters and lots of layers of clothes. They have not traveled with them yet, but they did do an experiment with stuffing one of them and they were amazed at what they were able to pack and how small they were to shrink the sack down to! They can't wait to use them next month for a ski trip. I have now decided to buy one for myself.
review.name: Ultra-Sil Compression Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used almost daily on our 9 week backpacking trip! Sturdy, easy to use, compressed easily,
review.name: Great compression sack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like so many Sea to Summit products this one delivers on all expectations. Light, water resistant (bordering on waterproof) and well made. Keep up the great work STS!!!
review.name: Another great Sea to Summit purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these for a beach vacay, with the hopes of compressing all my clothes, swim suits, etc to avoid a checked bag. I haven't gone on the trip yet, but I did test how many clothes it could stuff using clothes I had piled up in my hamper. I was very impressed, it could definitely hold more than a weeks outfits. the straps felt very durable. I was using my whole body weight and pulling as tight as I could, and the straps still felt like they weren't gonna budge. I'm very excited to be taking these on my trip, I'm looking forward to not having a huge mess of clothes and being able to comfortably pack other things in my carry on. Looking forward to using these on future trips!
review.name: Really well done!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Literally reduces the size of what I am packing to less than half. Will never go on a trip without this.
review.name: Necessity for packing

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I fly with carry-on luggage only, so being to get everything into my carry-on backpack is critical. These work extremely well for that purpose.I pack only synthetic clothes which don’t wrinkle, so crushing my clothes down is no problem.

Be sure to loosen all the straps when you unpack them, otherwise the shape of the tube will be uneven when you pack them next, and you won’t be able to pack them as efficiently. I think it’s helpful to own a few different sizes.
review.name: Will never travel without them.

name: Ultra-Sil 35L Compression Sack

review.reviewBody: First use was at Breckenridge with a mixed clouds and sun day. The lenses couldn’t have been better. I’ve got lenses for bluebird and cloudy / snowy days but these were absolutely perfect for the in between. So glad I had them.
review.name: First use was at Breckenridge

review.reviewBody:
I never purchased a Squad replacement lens or the goggle.
I have purchased an I/O Mag XL that your web info claimed was Eyewear compatible. I can assure you it is not.
Unless you are wearing a small frame pair of glasses it does not fit. Most new frames are slightly larger now. 
Unfortunately you have discontinued the
Knowledge goggles that still fit my glasses. 
Besides the fact that the I/O goggle only fits my old smaller size frame glasses is they come shipped in a cheap cardboard box with no travel case.
For that price I would expect a case.
review.name: I never purchased a Squad

review.reviewBody: Replacement lens is great by itself. However, seriously bummed that Smith is too cheap to send a sock for the spare lens. You’ll either have to buy your own or hope that the lens that you aren’t using doesn’t get scratched up.
review.name: Great lenses; Cheap Smith

review.reviewBody:
To say I was considerably underwhelmed by these shoes would be an understatement, in no small measure because of all the rave reviews this brand gets. 

The principal issue I had is with the quality of the shoes, as the stitching on the leading edge of the tongue and shoelace anchor failed after one MTB ride, causing the tongue to begin to separate from the shoe. Pretty pathetic for a tepid 8-mile ride.

I was also completely unimpressed with the the power transfer and pedal isolation of the midsole and outsole. These shoes are little better than wearing a pair of Converse All Stars, you feel everything when you're pedaling and waste an inordinate amount of energy compensating for lack of stiffness to put power on the pedals, which causes excess fatigue.

About the only positive on these shoes is the grip is decent, but not enough of a benefit to compensate for the deficiencies.
review.name: Poor quality and unsupportive to boot

name: Tallac Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: The Petzl Volta at 70m is definitely lighter than my 10mm @60m. I have only now received it and tried it on a short climb, it ties nice clean knots and rappels fine. Not big on the color, but believe that this will end up being my go rope for next spring. Thanks Backcountry for the quick service.
review.name: Nice Rope

review.reviewBody: Bought this for alpine climbing, great rope. Relatively light, durable sheath, handles well.
review.name: Great Alpine Rope

review.reviewBody: For most, we don?t think of a 9.2mm rope as hard wearing. However, I?m genuinely impressed in how well the Volta has held up after nearly a year of use. I initially purchased it for long multipitch ice and rock routes where I didn?t want dental floss, but also didn?t want to lug up a 10mm rope that would weigh as much as a ship anchor after a day of climbing on wet snow and ice. The 9.2 Volta struck a nice balance between weight, handling, and durability. It has survived terrain belays, sharp choss, sea cliff edges and dozens of late night dripping wet ice. I highly recommend this rope and I can assure you you don?t need to baby it. Petzl really outdid themselves with this rope
review.name: Hard wearing and great Handling.

name: Volta Dry Climbing Rope - 9.2mm

review.reviewBody: Design wasn't quite what we expected but width is good for movement and super low ghr weight
review.name: Light weight

review.reviewBody:
Used the size (EU and US) to choose (without actually measuring the foot). 
My son is 11US but it arrived way bigger than his actual shoes. They look amazing for next summer :smile:
Need to measure his foot next time.
review.name: Bigger than expected

review.reviewBody: So practical! Easy to clean, sturdy and good price. Removing one star for sizing that is always so big in Reima products. Also,the only color left was black and I would have preferred a more lively color for my child. Solid product!
review.name: Practical and sturdy

review.reviewBody: The quality of the materials is great - they are easy to clean and do really well in sand and water, but the shape of the footbed against the upper material chewed up my son's feet. He got a massive blister and a cut from wearing these the first time and we can't use them anymore.
review.name: Uncomfortable, not smooth on the inside

review.reviewBody: Nice wide toe boxes and easy for my son to put on and off by himself!
review.name: My son loves these

review.reviewBody: These shoes look like they could be nice but they are way too big! I sized down for my son after reading some reviews saying they run large, but they are so big still!! There is no way he will be able to wear them this summer hopefully next summer they will fit. . .
review.name: Sizing is off!

review.reviewBody: Sandals are awesome our daughter is scrambling around sharp lava rock in them. Very easy for her to put on by herself. Good quality
review.name: Good quality

review.reviewBody: These sandals are lightweight and durable. My children enjoy wearing them and reach for them often!
review.name: Lightweight and durable

review.reviewBody: Great little sandals. My 4 yr old twins can put them on and off themselves. The Velcro is really strong, I’m not worried about them loosing sticky ability. For reference, my boys are in 12 snow boots so I sized down and ordered 11.5 sandals thinking that would be good for the upcoming spring/summer. They were huge. Ended up reordering to size 10 and that fits them. Expect some issues with sizing.
review.name: Great sandal, size way down

review.reviewBody:
My kiddo loves these sandals. Says the best part is the two velcro straps in the back make it super easy to get on and off. I love that they dry quickly, give the foot lots of room to spread toes, and there hasn't been a single complaint of feet hurting during our summer adventures. 
*note: they do run big so definitely check the sizing chart to pick the right size - personally I like that they run big so little ones can stay in children sizes longer.
review.name: Great summer sandal

name: Koralli Sandal - Toddlers'

description: Buy the Marmot NanoWave 35 Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: NanoWave 35 Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot NanoWave 35 Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My husband and I have a slim build with narrow shoulders. I’m 5’6 and 130 lbs. The Nanowave 35 was too constrictive for both of us. The sleeping bag also seemed excessively long for me. We used an inflatable sleeping pad and the sleeping bag was warm until I turned on my side and then my back would get cold every time. Overall, it made for an uncomfortable night of sleep so we had to return them. They seemed well constructed otherwise.
review.name: Extremely narrow

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m in the Military and I’ve replaced my Woobie with the Nanowave bag 4 years ago. Its ability to pack into my Ruck and cut the crisp edge off the cold is superb. I use it like a quilt to cover my body while wearing my armor. I put my feet down in it and drape the rest of it over my top half. I can jump up off the ground and stuff it away very quickly. It’s perfect! I recommend it all the time to my coworkers. I love it.
review.name: Nanowave replaced my Woobie

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] used this sleeping bag for a 4-night backpacking trip in the Upper Peninsula MI with nights getting down to 36° and it held up great! My only complaint is it was a little tight around the shoulders and the cinch feature on the hood, one string pulled completely out on my last night. Probably just a manufacturing flaw but overall great bag!
review.name: awesome! Used for 4 nights in 40° weather

review.reviewBody: Great product but I’m 6’2 190 with wide shoulders and it’s uncomfortably tight should have gotten the bigger size
review.name: Alittle too small for me

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve had my nanowave for a few years, and after trying it out in multiple seasons it’s become pretty clear that this bag isn’t warm enough for any temps lower than 50°. To be fair, I am a cold sleeper. Otherwise, the bag is nice and relatively lightweight for the price
review.name: Good summer bag

review.reviewBody: I used this bag for a recent bike packing trip and it was amazing! It packed down super small and fit in my handlebar bag- which is impressive because it is a small size drop bar. The actual sleeping bag was perfect! Warm enough and super comfy- tons of room (though I am on the small side- 5'2). I would 100% recommend!
review.name: Perfect Bikepacking Bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for my son for our camping trip.  It is just what we needed.
review.name: Great sleeping bag.

review.reviewBody: My huge gripe with this bag is how narrow it is. I struggle to get it to zipper closed around my shoulders. Otherwise this is a very comfortable and pleasant bag. Packs down very small.
review.name: Quite narrow.

review.reviewBody: Great sleeping bag! Lightweight, comfortable, easy to stuff in a sack. I will say it is slightly less roomy at the upper torso and shoulders. It shouldn’t stop you from buying it unless you have a large upper torso. You could just unzip it or sideways sleep. All in all if you’re not the hulk and you’re into quality then do it.
review.name: Sweet bag!

review.reviewBody: Great product. I got it for my wife an it’s perfect. I’m 5’11” and so it was too short so I bought the long version for myself. You can’t go wrong with Marmot.
review.name: Bag for people under 5’11”

name: NanoWave 35 Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic

description: Buy the Giordana Toester Shoes Toe Covers online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Toester Shoes Toe Covers
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giordana Toester Shoes Toe Covers online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
As the others have noted these definitely run small. I wear a 43.5 Sidi shoe yet the Large size was so small it fell off my foot when I was walking and I lost it. So I've replaced them with an X Large size.
The good thing is they keep my toes warm from the mid 40's F thorough the 50's F. I also wear them under my booties during winter temperatures in the 20's F and less. Definitely worth it but size up a size...
review.name: Run small but are effective...

review.reviewBody: I use these for for rides in the 40 degree temps and they work great! I did notice some cold toes on rides I started in the 30's, but thats what i expected and didnt want to get the full shoe covers out. They slide on and off easily which is great when temps start to rise and i want to stop and stow them away midride. For reference, I have a 45.5 (11.5) shoe and the XL's are perfect; I wouldnt want anything smaller or larger.
review.name: Great Toe Warmer

review.reviewBody:
couldn't be happier with these. they're perfect for brisk days, where i don't need to wear the full shoe covers, but it's too cold to wear just warmer socks.

my first time out with these, i made a mistake and must not have fully pulled them over my cleats, which tore part of fabric.
review.name: did their job

name: Toester Shoes Toe Covers

review.reviewBody: i bought these for her so she could have a more outdoor capable walking shoe. neither of us climb so we've never heard of an approach shoe before. she's been happy with these and where she wears a size 7.5 in sketchers she needed a size 8 in these. i really only left the review to help others with the sizing but you can also be happy knowing she also finds these comfortable.
review.name: my girlfriend is very happy

review.reviewBody: This shoes are OK. They are soft, so I'm not sure how long they will hold up. They look ok, but nothing exciting. The heel slouches in back ever so slightly. They do seem to have a sticky bottom.  I would have returned them, if return shipping was free. They do run small, so I sized up 1/2 size.
review.name: Meh

review.reviewBody: When evolv discontinued/changed their classic I tried these for approach shoes. Black diamond told me they would be the faster drying of their approach shoes and they would expand some. They did not expand, take forever to dry out and the grip is AWFUL. They are street shoes and terrible as approach shoes.
review.name: Sole not grippy

review.reviewBody: a little floppy for my personal taste in approach shoes but very comfortable with a decent grip.
Vraiment très confortable bien que ne supporte pas trop le pied. Cela dit, on se sent comme dans des pantoufles!
I have had a great time using them to scramble up faces, go to work, and go mountain biking.
review.name: Great shoe, fits true to size

review.reviewBody: Enjoy the look that can be worn in the office and makes a quick transition to hiking or scrambling in the field. Great all around fit, and seems quite durable (been wearing nearly non-stop for 2 months now).
review.name: From the office to the field

review.reviewBody: These shoes are the bomb! They're light yet supportive and extremely comfortable - I may buy another pair for bar hopping!
review.name: Highly Recommend

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. I have high arches so arch support is a little lacking for me, but that’s standard.
review.name: Recommend

review.reviewBody: I love this shoe! It's so versatile- I live in a CO mountain town and the Mojave desert and this shoe has been a great everyday shoe or a short hike shoe in both locations. I feel confident leaving the office to climb up a scree hill or walking my dogs over the snow! It's definitely my go-to choice as it's warm enough for below freezing and not too hot for 100+ degrees. The fit was great right out of the box. If I had to complain (and that's a big IF), the ball of my foot by the big toe isn't always a fan of the climbing grip there on a longer hike (4+miles) but that's to be expected- I wouldn't change it because using that to boulder up a peak is extremely useful. The color was a little lighter grey than expected, but that works okay for me since they get sandy from the desert. The sand brushes off with ease, too! I highly recommend these shoes.
review.name: Versatile shoe

name: Circuit Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: Instant Field Repair Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Instant Field Repair Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I haven't used this kit and hope I will never need it . I travel to fairly remote places so have this in case my Therma rest leaks.
review.name: Haven't use this Kit

review.reviewBody: The cover patches are so bad, almost impossible to peal of without damaging them. Imagen doing it at night in the forest, absolutely horrible.
review.name: Blah

review.reviewBody: A collection of patches for repairing your leaky sleeping pad in the field. Please note that many pads now come with a repair patch and this repair kit may only be useful for long-distance or thru-hikers who may need more than 1 patch.
review.name: May be redundant

review.reviewBody: I got a flat tire on my bicycle and didn't have any spare tubes or bicycle tube patch kits, so I decided to give the field repair kit a try. It held for about 40 min on a road tube at 60-70 psi, then began to leak. It would probably hold longer at lower pressure but isn't a good permanent fix. If it's all you have, it might get you home though! It also probably would work better on a lower pressure tube, like a mountain bike or gravel bike, but I have not tried this.
review.name: Bicycle tube repair in a pinch

review.reviewBody:
I had 3 small punctures from something very sharp. The punctures are 3-6mm long.
Bought the "Instant field repair kit" and applied as instructed but it didn't feel right with the glue spots, they were quite hard and I wasn't able to "smear" them out, needed to use 5 glue spots and 3 patches for the holes. seems airtight but didn't had the time to test before going out again for 8 nights. Bought another Thermarest Neoiar Topo Luxe just to be sure to get the sleep during our exercise.
I might have done something wrong with the repair kit but read it again after coming home.
review.name: Glue spots unable to "smear" out

review.reviewBody: I haven't had to use the repair kit yet, btu I'm sure all will be fine.
review.name: I haven't had to use

review.reviewBody: Great to have…just in case! Hope that I won’t need to use. Looks easy enough to use.
review.name: Easy to use

review.reviewBody: This is the best patch kit for thermarest pads. I've also used it on drybags and jackets. Easy to use and carry and works every time.
review.name: Reliability in a patch kit

review.reviewBody: the patch works great! no rolling of the edges! love it!
review.name: the patch works great! no

review.reviewBody: The mondoking XL is a great pad! Works great for car camping. I spent a month on it after surgery and it was life saver.
review.name: works great down to 20 degrees and great for surgery

name: Instant Field Repair Kit

review.reviewBody: Love the color and fit for the most part, but the snow skirt could be lower and have more attachment points to clip to pants. When falling on my snowboard the skirt keeps sliding up. Slightly longer sleeves would be ideal also. Perhaps 1-2" more in length that way I can actually get the cuff to stay fully at wrist inside of gloves, or the addition of a snow skirt in a way on the sleeve because when you fall the sleeves slide up and you get snow in your sleeve.
review.name: Powder Quest review

review.reviewBody: Great coat! I have way too many ski coats but this is the one I choose first. Six pockets on the outside, ladies! SIX POCKETS. Two interior pockets as well. Hood is adjustable and fits over ski helmet, and can be tightened down to not impede side vision. Outer fabric is soft and pliable and the jacquard pattern hides the inevitable dirt from skiing. Insulation is great - 100g throughout sleeves and body (I HATE when they put less warmth in the sleeves bc that is always the first part to get cold!) and I was warm with appropriate layers in any condition. Only criticism would be that I would like to have more varied colors. The turquoise and blue options are very similar and warm and bright colors would be great for visibility: red, orange, yellow, etc. Overall, a great skiing coat for a great price and would absolutely buy another in a more fun color!
review.name: Awesome warm flexible ski coat with enough pockets to skip a backpack

review.reviewBody: Super warm and enough space for my shoulders! I like the color and the sizing was perfect for my athletic build! Im a climber so I have shoulders and arms that feel constricted sometimes but I got a medium and it was perfect! So pleased with the fit. I had to add a bigger zipper pull to the main front zipper bc the little string is too small to find/feel with gloves on
review.name: Loved it so much!

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. My favorite features are the dual zipper, the 6 exterior pockets, and how warm it kept me! It kept me protected from elements and not too warm in 40 degree sunny weather, and completely toasty in 15 degree weather with just a base and a thin fleece mid layer.
review.name: So great!

review.reviewBody: Bought this in black and the thing I love the most are all the zipper pockets! I’m short (5 feet) and the bottom zippers are a perfect height for my hands. The side zippers are all really deep and I love the feature of the shared zipper. I wore this in 15 degree weather and only needed a base layer and a micro fleece pullover and I was warm and toasty.
review.name: So great!

review.reviewBody: These are rad...wish they made a Men's version of these.  As a dude it's nice to have different color/style options than the same old boring plain colors and designs. Cheers!
review.name: Wish they had these colors/styles in Mens!

name: Powder Quest Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I now have two Sense Ride 5 pairs, and one Salomon Sense Ride pair from 3 years ago.  I love this shoe.
review.name: Sense ride 5

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been buying Sense rides for several years, and I agree with other long-time users that these are no longer comfortable.  The front is cramped and no adjusting the laces helps because it's too narrow in front. I found myself taking them off even when sitting.  Wish I could return.
review.name: why change a great shoe?  now cramped in front
comment: Hi, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought the woman’s Sense Ride over a year ago.  It’s comfortable, durable on the hiking trails, and it’s nice looking!  Recently I bought the same shoe as mine are wearing down.  I love these shoes!!!
review.name: Great comfortable trail shoe!!!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great shoe for trail running on dry trails as it's not waterproof
review.name: comfortable shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've always considered Sense Rides to be 'ole reliable' as it is my favorite trail running shoe, especially the Sense Ride 3's and 4's. But when it comes to the Sense Ride 5, in my experience it is noticeably worse. I purchased these shoes 3 months ago in August, it is now November, and the mesh fabric has already completely given up in both the left and right shoe in the exact location. With the older Sense Rides, I used to wear the shoes down until the lugs were flattened without experiencing compromises such as this. Not to mention the fit of the toe box being uncomfortably small. It's a huge bummer knowing I have to spend that much more money to replace a shoe that never used to require it, let alone the inherent waste that creates.
review.name: Bring back the old Sense Rides

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been wearing sense rides for several years now with 5 pairs, which I have enjoyed with the exception of one model having uppers that ripped. These are the worse iteration, they have a strange fit , wider (?) and just aren’t as comfortable as the older versions, also they aren’t as grippy in the trails. Please bring back the old 3 and 4 versions or something close and love to see shoes for those of us with a narrower foot!
review.name: Don’t like this version
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I used these for my 30km trail race. It held up well and no blisters! I would prefer my cushion in a shoe. But overall, solid shoe and great durability. I will race again with these shoes.
review.name: Great trail running shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm not a regular trail runner, but I bought my first pair of Sense Rides three years ago for casual hiking, and I loved them. I bought these new Sense Ride 5s for the look and feel, especially for arch and heel support after an Achilles tendon injury. These shoes feel great!
review.name: Love the look and feel

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the Sense Ride line and these were my second purchase. I’m not a regular trail runner, but I like these for the support, grip, and feel after an Achilles tendon injury. I’d buy them again!
review.name: Comfy support and style

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: While the shoe excels in design and fit, the lack of breathability due to the extra material holding the tongue is a significant drawback.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Icon Uprisal Sweatpant - Men's
review.reviewBody: The fit on these is WAY too large. Neither the quality nor the look of these sweatpants merits the price. Also, it's 2023 and Backcountry is still making you pay for return shipping ($7)? I don't think I've paid return shipping for any store in years. I've spent thousands of dollars at Backcountry in the past but I will no longer use any service that makes you pay for return shipping. Backcountry is stuck in 2015.
review.name: Why is Backcountry still in business

review.reviewBody:
I've been using an old SIDI cross country shoe with a super stiff sole for many years before finally wearing them out and switching to this.  It's definitely a more trail oriented shoe and its super nice that's its actually wearable off the bike.  

At first I was worried the fastlace would get in the way but its actually designed to tuck away into the forefoot laces and then under the strap for a clean look and no chance of getting caught up anywhere on the bike.  I have the BOA laces on a road pair of Giro's and don't think its worth the extra $50 on this shoe unless that's the only size option available, then I wouldn't hesitate to pick it up instead of the fastlace.

And sizing is spot on, true for me with no hot spots yet.
review.name: Awesome Trail Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I?ve had Giro Gauges for years and I?ve tried a few other models from them as well. These are definitely a comfortable and a quality shoe. The soles are somewhat stiff but not as stout as the carbon soled models. 

I would say these are geared more for a casual trail and cross country mtb shoe. For competitive cyclocross and race ready mtb riding I would want something a bit stiffer. However these are perfect for those weekend trail days where you may get off the bike and walk back up the jump line or have a few hike-a-bike moments. These are also good off the bike to walk up and order coffee or grab a long lunch and beer after the ride. 

The quicklace feature is nice as well. Seems like a good alternative to the BOA system with much less opportunity for trail failure or maintenance. The lace up is snug and quick to engage. I do feel like the long lace is a bit awkward to tuck away afterwords and the Velcro strap over the top may be unneeded as the tension at the top of the lace is already very tight. I think maybe the Velcro could have been a more clever storage pocket for the extra lace material instead. 

They run pretty true to size and the materials are high quality and a nice lightweight and breathable construction. The soles are for sure more grippy than my gauges were. Stoked to put more miles on these.
review.name: Pretty good but not the best Giro shoe

review.reviewBody: I ordered these and the Giro Gauges (both 45). The Gauges were way too low volume and uncomfortable on my toes. A gearhead let me know that the Ventana uses a different Giro shoe last more like their flat shoes and it was way more comfortable. The bungee stays put in the little hook and the velcro is exactly what you need to make sure your heel doesn't slip. I've worn these on 4 rides so far and they are holding up great - comfortable to ride in, stiff to climb in, and make me feel more confident on the trails.
review.name: Great shoes

name: Ventana Fastlace Cycling Shoe

review.reviewBody: This is the most useful and ingenious  product.  I use these constantly after workouts an daily water bottle use and they keep my water bottles impeccable! I give them also as gifts and everyone  is always so grateful for such a useful item.
review.name: The Holy Grail of water bottle  cleaning!

review.reviewBody: This stuff is magic! I make "Cowboy Coffee" so the enameled metal pot is used hard but is tough to clean. Two tabs of Bottle Bright in warm water cleans it perfectly without leaving a taste. One tab in my coffee cups takes out even the worst stains although I have to use warm water and let  them sit. I've tried the home remedies such as vinegar, but they just don't work. Bottle Bright is da' bomb!
review.name: Bottle Bright Tabs Clean Without Leaving A Taste

review.reviewBody: These tablets are excellent at breaking up the gunk that can accumulate in the crevices of the soft flasks, and also help keep metal water bottles clean. The ease of use and lack of harsh chemicals make them a staple cleaning product to keep on hand.
review.name: Easy and effective

review.reviewBody: The Bottle Bright tablets are Easy to use and take care of the water scum that is difficult to reach.
review.name: Dirty water bottles

review.reviewBody: Bought to take taste out of 3L Hydra Pak, didn't work.  Disappointed in both products.  Tried all 4 of their methods to eliminate plastic taste... none worked.  So Maybe it's just the bladder that's uncurable, not sure...
review.name: Might work elsewhere, didn't work on HydraPak 3L
comment:
Thank you for the feedback, we appreciate it! We can gladly replace your 3L under our warranty program, since the taste persists. Please file a claim here:
https://support.hydrapak.com/hc/en-us

After you have filed a claim, we will respond to your ticket very quickly, usually within 1-2 days.

Thank you!

review.reviewBody: These work so good!  It works just like it says on their website.
review.name: Great product!  It works

review.reviewBody: BEST IN TOWN, Will recommend to others and my family member
review.name: BEST IN TOWN

review.reviewBody: Easy to use and rinses out thoroughly. You can use other cleaners but this stuff is the easiest and it does a good job in my opinion.
review.name: Good Stuff

review.reviewBody: This product blew me away. I can't stop telling my friends about it.
review.name: Night and Day
