review.reviewBody: I love these. Light weight, very comfortable. They do run small.
review.name: Great!

review.itemreviewed: ADV Nordic Speed 2 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I usually buy Saucony shoes.  These shoes feel great, awesome, amazing!!  But the foot odor is horrendous!  I’ve never had odor like this in any other shoes.  I wear 100% cotton socks.  I’ve washed them, washed the insoles, used sprays, used the odor balls, etc.  Nothing helps.  I don’t think I can buy them again because they smell so bad:(
review.name: Foot ODOR

review.itemreviewed: ADV Nordic Speed 2 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these shoes without ever having tried on a pair of Craft shoes, and just hoped for the best.    I really searched for any reviews or information about these shoes before purchasing, and could find very little.  The risk paid off! 

Sizing-- I'm somewhere between an 8M and 8.5M.   I wear an 8 in most Asics, but an 8.5 in Nike, if that helps anyone.  I bought these in 8.5 and they fit perfectly, I can't imagine they could fit any better.    My foot is not particularly wide, but I have high instep and high arches.  

Performance-- I would not call these shoes cushioned, but they have a very pleasant "spring" when walking or running, especially on hard surfaces.   I do find I have to make sure the laces are tight to keep my heels from slipping at all, but the laces are nice and long, and easy to secure.   I love the reinforced material on the toes, which helps protect that area from rocks and even from my toes.   They have a ton of stability and a nice, neutral feel.  

I bought these in the mint/celedon and the colors are great.   

Overall, I just love these shoes so far, and hope they withstand a beating.   Fingers crossed!
review.name: Absolutely in love!

name: ADV Nordic Speed 2 Running Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Pinnacle 4L Hydration Vest - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Fit was perfect and NO SLOSHING! The bottles are great! The flexible bottle allow air to be removed and keeps a perfect "seal" during the whole run. I love the variety of pockets for gu/chews, keys, phone, ear bud case. I keep a rain jacket in the back in case the weather turns on long runs. I use this thing regardless of mileage because of the ease of carrying anything I would need. I was worried that fit wouldn't work on me as I am plus size and have a large chest, but the vest was true to size chart and works perfectly.
review.name: Great Fit. No Sloshing.

review.reviewBody: The fit is snug and no chafing. Lots of pockets for storage so I can see myself using this for all my longer runs.
review.name: Versatile and comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is my first running vest and i love it! Very comfortable and easy to drink out of, and stores a lot of water.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I purchased this vest as an 'upgrade' from my VaporHowe 4L 2.0 because it was marketed as being 20% lighter. I absolutely love my VaporHowe but the fabric is thicker and not very breathable. With the summer heat wave that most of the country is experiencing, the 20% lighter in this new version was a big selling point. It definitely does feel cooler, is more lightweight, and is more breathable, and I do love the fit; however, there is a huge design flaw with the HydraPak flask pockets that's very disappointing. Apparently the pockets are deeper than those on the VaporHowe, because as the flask empties, it sinks down into the pocket and the top of the straw no longer stays tucked into the top flap. The straw flops around everywhere and hits me in the face at times. It's SO AGGRAVATING. Never had that problem with my VaporHowe. The straw stayed tucked in until I pulled it out to drink.  For my next long run, I'll have to stuff a washcloth or small towel into the bottom of the pocket so the bottle won't sink down into the too deep pocket and the straw will stay tucked in. Shouldn't have to do that for the price point of this vest.
review.name: More lightweight and breathable, but...

review.reviewBody: This vest is perfect for long runs! It doesn’t chafe, has plenty of pockets, plenty of hydration options.
review.name: Perfect for long runs!

review.reviewBody: The water bottles are so bouncy.  I’m not sure if the size of mine was off but it is so horribly uncomfortable to wear.  I sized up assuming with layers I’d need the bigger size and that was a mistake.  I literally cannot wear this vest due to the bounce of the water bottles.  They felt as if they were going to fly out of the vest, but most annoyingly the extended straws kept smacking me in the chin.
review.name: Bouncy
comment: Hello and thank you for your review of our Nathan Pinnacle 4 Liter Women's Hydration Vest. I deeply apologize for the fit of yours. Please contact our customer service department at (800) 233-6956 or cs@unitedspb.com and we will assist you further with this matter.

review.reviewBody: Love the vest, bottles are easy to access, vest is light and comfortable and easily adjustable on the fly.  Hope to use it on longer runs in the future, but seems to hold everything I would need.
review.name: Great vest ... light, comfy & easily adjustable

review.reviewBody: I love the color and how light weight the hydration pack is. The pockets are very conveniently located.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: I got this hydration vest for my first half-marathon. I tried it out two days ago on a practice run/walk and it was perfect. The two water bottles supply as much water as I need, and it was so easy to get the water from them - no need to pull the bottles out like with a fanny pack, and the "straws" are tall enough so I don't need to bend my head to get the water as I walk/run. All the pockets are terrific for gels, phone and other things. It's very lightweight and comfortable to wear.
review.name: Perfect way to get water as you go

review.reviewBody: I love this vest. It’s lightweight and has tons of pockets. I wore it for a marathon a few weeks ago and it didn’t cause any chaffing problems.. I do wish I had went a size up though.. I was borderline medium/large measurements. Wish I had went with the large instead.
review.name: Great vest

name: Pinnacle 4L Hydration Vest - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My bottle had the insulation compromised. I applied for the refund on the hydro flask website. After I got the information I was informed to return the bottle to the address provided. I returned the bottle along with the top. I assumed that the top was supposed to go back, since I purchased the bottle with the top. I had a wide mouth straw top. When I got my new bottle it just had the twist on top. review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Flex Cap 2.0 Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This company stinks. Don’t buy from them. I bought a blue 40oz bottle, it had a factory defect i didn’t notice until months later. I tried to get a replacement. The two nasty reps gave me attitude about what took me so long to make the claim. I said what does it matter it’s a lifetime warranty. They ended up sending me a different color bottle. Completely different color and style cap. They also refused to re engrave my name on the bottle. Which I had paid for on my original bottle. I called them about it and they told me there was nothing they can do. I told them there was something I could do. I will go back to the coldest water company bottles. They honor their lifetime warranty and do their engraving in the warehouse where they ship from. Hydro flask out sources the engraving. They got to big and only cares about the bottom line not its customers. DO NOT BUY THEIR PRODUCTS!
review.name: Lifetime warranty

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Flex Cap 2.0 Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are our favorite water bottles. Great quality, keeps our drinks cold all day
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Flex Cap 2.0 Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: My uncle adopted my hydro flask for me early 2022. At first I was upset that it was not some cool trendy water bottle but when I got used to her unique look, I knew she was the one for me. She is my amazing beautiful child, and I think of her as my biological child. I fell in love, she is my pride and joy and i'm so grateful that i'm able to watch her grow into the beautiful young lady she will become.
review.name: My pride and joy

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Flex Cap 2.0 Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Hydroflask is one of my favorites. I love how you back your products!!! Keep up the good work
review.name: My favorite

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First pair of clip in cycle shoes and couldn't be more pleased with these shoes. Look great, feel great and highly recommended.
review.name: But these!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice shoe fits as advertised. Comfortable on and off the bike.  Tons of grip too!
review.name: Reliable and comfortable shoe for mountain biking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fantastic shoes with a fantastic price, so comfortable for the bike.
review.name: Great item

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Recessed well for cleat makes this easy to walk in.
review.name: Great combo shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good fit for narrow feet. Secure strap feels very comfortable.
review.name: Good solid shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice change to the usual mtb spd shoe, nice and comfy
review.name: Nice shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very narrow fit so had to return but they looked like a good design
review.name: Narrow fitting

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Decent bike shoes.  I'm the owner of a very old and battered pair of Specialized Tahoes.  I would have done a like-for-like replacement, but they are no longer in production.  The five tens seemed good, so I took the plunge.

The recommendation is to size up, which I did (half a size).  As they are narrow (and my foot wide) it has meant the widest part of my foot doesn't quite sit at the widest part of the shoe.  I've had similar issues with other Adidas shoes and am hoping these stretch a little.  It isn't unbearable, but I'd prefer an experience on the bike where I don't even notice my feet at all.

The shoes themselves seem well made.  Walking with the cleats attached is great and on the bike they feel stiff enough.  I've not been able to test them in a wide range of temperatures yet, but at close to 10 degrees (Celcius) my feet felt fine.
review.name: Good purchase (but narrow).

review.reviewBody: Really comfortable for the gym, good for running too !
review.name: Love em

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable, well designed, great color scheme. Serves the purposed of riding the trails and walking to the coffee shop
review.name: Great all around cycling shoe

name: Trailcross Clip-In Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Comfortable light adjusts well will fit over a beanie. The clips and rear fixing for a head lamp are nice. i would purchase this a second time.
review.name: Nice Helmet

review.reviewBody: This helmet is super comfortable and fits my big head, even with a thin beanie on underneath.  Haven't had to crash test it yet, hope I never have to!! Went with the MIPS technology, because why not?  I use my head to make a living and I believe that if I ever do hit my head hard, it will be money well spen.
review.name: Super comfy and fits my big head

review.reviewBody: Worth the money to go with the mips version. As far as the capitan helmet it vents good and is fully adjustable as well as adjustments go in helmet when not in use. Took a few rocks on this last trip and helmet held up and did as advertised.
review.name: Best helmet to date

review.reviewBody: Wore my new helmet all day without having to fidget and adjust for comfort. Hardly knew I had it on. Also purchased this helmet for safety on the crag. Being on blood thinning medication I’m concerned about a possible head injury. I’m always conscious of safety but accidents do happen. Thanks for the added protection.
review.name: Comfort and safety

review.reviewBody: Took a ground fall well climbing wearing this helmet a couple days ago, hit my head pretty hard and walked away from it thanks to this helmet, I’m planning on ordering another one to replace it as it did take minor damage. 100% would recommend
review.name: Works

review.reviewBody: Fits well, has a great place to put a headlamp and it feels great to know I have a good piece of gear on my head protecting me.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Low profile. Can barely tell it’s there until it was needed then was glad after a rock from up top
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and adjustable so I can put a hat underneath. Covers all the important parts of the skull for AT
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody: Bought as a multidisciplinary helmet for backcountry skiing and climbing (ice and rock). Love it! Super comfy, light, and confidence Inspiring. Hoping to see more helmets with MIPS!
review.name: All around great helmet!

review.reviewBody: Its nice to see MIPS getting into the climbing world and this helmet is nice and comfortable
review.name: A good helmet

name: Capitan Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: 😒😒 It's obvious that someone has never been outdoors before. The inner layer is too bright, that should also be dark too!
comment:
Hello,
Thanks for your message. We appreciate you contacting us. Thank you for reaching out to us. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused by our product. We will strive to improve next time.
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us , at 1-800-835-3278 or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am -5pm Eastern Time. 
Thank you! 
Coleman Customer Care

review.reviewBody: I freeze in my old 0 degree bag. I hated the old coffin style where you were squeezed together. This bag was sooooo warm. Temps only got down to 32 but it was so comfortable. Could sleep any way I wanted to. I’m 6’0 and I could fully cover my head and put a pillow inside for max warmth
review.name: Most comfortable sleeping bag in history

review.reviewBody: This was for an outdoor weekend getaway, unfortunately it did not come before the weekend despite being ordered Monday. Should have followed my instinct once I saw that the five-star reviews were from a 'promo campaign'. Just buy from anywhere else.
review.name: Waited on the help line for an hour
comment:
Hello! We are sorry to hear your Game™ 0°F Big & Tall Sleeping Bag did not arrive on time. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We will make sure that your thoughts are shared because we value and truly appreciate your feedback. If you require assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us directly via our "Contact Us" Form on our website. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9 am - 5 pm Eastern Time. 
Thank you! 
Coleman Consumer Care. 
Have an amazing day!

review.reviewBody: I use it camping on cold nights in the desert and I can sleep like a baby now.  No worries about feeling cold in this bag.
review.name: Big, warm and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was great for my lastest trip to north Texas. It was in the 20’s at our deer lease, and it kept me nice and warm while I slept. I definitely recommend this sleeping bag. The padding and length was perfect!
review.name: Wow!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm, roomy and super comfortable sleeping bag. I also used this bag as a blanket, and it works well too. The sleeping bag is good quality, smoothly zips up, but too big to  backpack. We usually car camp at state park, so it is easy to transport. Recommend.
review.name: Great sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great sleeping bag for cold weather. It is built well, durable, and keeps you warm. It is also spacious enough for me that I don’t feel too snug in it which is very nice as it allows me to sleep comfortably. It rolls up nicely and packs away easily. It is easy to unroll and lay out to sleep in.
review.name: Warm and durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for an outdoor weekend get away to Big Bend here in Texas. This sleeping bag is awesome. It's large and super comfy. The product is high quality and is something that is going to last. I highly recommend.
review.name: Awesome and Durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought a XL for my father in law who played football in college. Needless to say, he is a large man and this sleeping bag was big enough to fit him comfortably. It was also super warm in cold mountain weather. Highly recommend.
review.name: Warm, Large Sleeping Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It had been a while since last time I was shopping for a sleeping bag. Was shopping for our camping trip, and is overwhelming due to so many different ones. At the end, I made the best choice... Coleman has the best quality for your money. Sometimes is better to stick with what you already know it works.
review.name: Can never go wrong with Coleman!

name: Big Game 0F Sleeping Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit for me. I have been looking for an everyday pack (going to work and travel) that is a good fit for me for quite a while. I wanted a waxed canvas pack but I had trouble finding something that worked best for me. I had to return a few before I stumbled upon this one (AER, GORUCK). This pack fits my everyday needs. it has a good number of pockets, it is able to hold a lot of weight and although the size is a little bit too large for me, it does offer the ability for more if needed. The material is high quality, heavier than my other Osprey day packs, the zippers are sturdy and reliable. The fit is good but I wish that the straps were curved for comfort and better fit.
review.name: Great fit for me. I

review.reviewBody: La mochila tiene muchos bolsillos con zipper excepto los que tiene a los lados que son perfectos para las botellas de agua. En el interior es espaciosa al punto que los papeles tamaño legal 8.5x14 caben perfecto sin que se doblen. La recomiendo.
review.name: La mochila está brutal

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this bag, great for school and travel! Sturdy and water resistant.
review.name: Love this bag, great for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A bit smaller in terms of internal space as compared to other packs of the same advertised volume
review.name: A bit smaller in terms

review.reviewBody: This has been the best backpack I have ever had. I have used it for a year and still looks brand new.
review.name: Great overall backpack

review.reviewBody: Good quality. Nice variety of compartments. Side pockets fit a Nalgene- even my 48 ounce fits nicely/doesn’t slide out when I set it down, like other packs.
review.name: Solid work pack

review.reviewBody: Love this bag. Have previously put osprey bags and was delighted to find out they make reasonably priced school bags. Bought for college and even two years later looks as good as new. The material is very resilient and pretty decent when caught in the rain. Love the big pockets to fit a Nalgene. I use the top lined pocket as a pencil pouch and the other compartments hold anything else I could need. Laptop sleeve fits my large computer easily and protects it well, as I often forget it’s in there. My only complaint is that when using it for weekend trips, I need to make sure to pack out the bottom in order to use all the available space because it is a bit top heavy with the pockets. That said it’s large enough to fit school work and clothes for a weekend trip. Great blue color and blends in with the usual Patagonia and north face backpacks while still being unique.
review.name: The Ultimate College Bag

I am 5'10"" 140 and this pack fits very comfortably and closely even when loaded down, love all the organization and materials. Water bottle sleeves accommodate my yeti bottle well, and the large internal sleeve is great for my level iiia soft ballistic plate!
review.name: Perfect School Bag!!!

description: Buy the Black Diamond Whippet Attachment online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Whippet Attachment
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Whippet Attachment online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Have yet to really put this pick to use. I got it for spring steeps. It fit quickly into the whippet ready pole set. It comes with the rubber protector BTW.
review.name: handy and easy to swap.

review.reviewBody: I don't go on steep snow without this. It is always there and rarely in the way so I don't get lazy taking it out for a short slope and have been known to use it more than once when I wouldn't have taken out an ice axe.
review.name: Solid tool

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality. Seems incredibly durable. Convenient with wr poles
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody:
I've taken a few falls on dicey stratovolcano terrain -- not exactly 'no-fall' zones, but really awful falls that one would prefer to avoid. This whippet worked surprisingly well in the "oh sh#t" moment, that factional second when time slows and action happens faster than thought. Save myself lots of pain and suffering, as well as inconvenience, on the mountain. Light, easy to remove/attach, and saves the weight of an additional ice tool/axe. 

It's a staple of my adventuring pack. Highly recommend.
review.name: Saved my a$$ (a few times)

review.reviewBody:
Easy to attach
Works too self arrest on moderate angles.
Great piece of mind on the mountain.
review.name: It will stop you

review.reviewBody: I have always been hesitant to dedicate one pole to a full-time whippet. The idea of having the small ice axe hanging off the front when it isn't needed has not appealed to me. Carrying it and two other poles is not an option as an ultralgiht ice axe is more useful. This new attachment is exactly what I wanted. I can justify carrying it for steep and no-fall-zone ski descents and backup purposes while still carrying an ice axe in ski mountaineering. The alpine version is on my list of devices to compare, but for now, this is a useful, well proportioned, and the attachment does not show signs of possible failure that I feared. Also, the pole system allows to repurpose your poles as tent poles in one of BD's nearly freestanding tents. I have ye to try the combination but for those really counting ounces, that could be a great set up!
review.name: Small, light, and adaptable

review.reviewBody: Have always loved whippets and still have a pair of the original design. The new removable version is solid.
review.name: Great accessory

review.reviewBody: While it looks a bit wonky and feels like you're choking a crow in your hand at first, its a great tool for those times when you just don't want to fall and need some extra confidence that you have a means to prevent a disaster. Whether backcountry skiing or spring and winter mountaineering, wherever my poles go this goes too.
review.name: Just in case

review.reviewBody: Disabled Senior living in large urban city and walk or use public transit with a service dog. Cars don't stop for you even if you are in the crosswalk and they have a red light. Many speed up to beat you to the curb a curb cut on a sidewalk. They think twice before rolling in past you or speeding up when they see your poles with a Whippit. I use my carbide tips when walking in traffic and around town then cover with rubber tips when I go into a building. That way I have some protection on from ends of the pole. Works for geocaching and picking up litter etc. Also a personal protection device on urban trails at night. Very useful tool in Urban settings as well as out in parks. Please make your top of line Trekking Poles available in 140 size. I have to go to your aluminum or non collapsing poles that are also not for trails. Thanks
review.name: Works on Pro Shock Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: Pins holding everything together broke off after the second use... Poor quality.
review.name: Would be good if it didn't break after the 2nd use

name: Whippet Attachment

review.reviewBody: I ordered the Kayla in Chalk size 4 and was initially surprised to read the comments saying the sizing was too small. The Chalk pair fit a lot looser than expected. I could enjoy a massive feast and have ample room for expansion. Then I got 2 more pairs of Kayla, also size 4, one in Indigo, one in Black out. The Indigo fit as I expected and hoped: comfortable, form fitting, but definitely not too tight. The Black however, were tighter throughout the legs and especially the waist. Holding the black pair against the other pairs, the waist band is visibly 1" - 1.5" smaller than the chalk and indigo, serious muffin topping and slicing to get the button closed. I surmise the Black was a previous season pattern cut. It seems in 2023 Prana made the Kayla a little more generous, which is nice for an active lifestyle and not overly stressing the fabric or compressing the belly. Of course, there are small fit differences among pants of the same size. The current 2023 season colors I have in Chalk and Indigo are relatively close in fit with minor differences. I'd say they are more like slim to "normal" fit. But in the case of the Black, I'd interpret a full size up from what the size chart says. Those were definitely cut from a different pattern and they are more on the slim cut side. Why I've kept going back to Prana pants over the past 8 or more years, is because I have narrower hips, longer legs, stronger thighs and butt. Prana pants generally fit my more muscular proportions better, are flattering, not overly constricting and good for activity as well as work appropriate.
review.name: Sizing Note

review.reviewBody: After just a few everyday wears and only once through the washer, the elastic in the fabric is already showing signs of giving way—the fit looks and feels a size larger now than they were at purchase, and you can see the elastic rippling and buckling at the hip line. It's like the whole pant has just drooped. The denim is also very thin and delicate and already showing significant signs of pilling & wear at chafe points. I'm disappointed because they looked great to start with and I wish I'd gotten a little more use out of them before they started to get this scruffy.
review.name: Poor Materials

review.reviewBody: Purchased for my wife, def way smaller than normal sizes.
review.name: So small and tight

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these jeans - they?re a little snugger than I would normally wear, but were still comfortable and passed the ?flattering or not? husband question (he?s honest and has no issue saying ?not?). It never occurred to me that I needed to check the back view prior to washing them.  Unfortunately,  I should have.  The material is soft, but very thin.  I put them on after washing them and did a 360 degree check. To my dismay, in brighter light, every lump and bump on the backs of my thighs is visible. If you have so much as a scrap of cellulite, you will be displaying it to the world (at least in the color Sparrow). I?ve never run into this before and will end up donating them without every wearing them.
review.name: Check the back view before washing
comment:
Hey Anne!

I'm so sorry to hear about your experience with these. I know it's been awhile but if you still have them, please reach out to a Gearhead and we'd be happy to set up a return or exchange for you!

review.reviewBody: I ordered both the green and red jeans and tried them both on. I would have kept both pairs, but after wearing them around the house for a day they began to stretch out at the knees and waist. I usually wear a size 0 in jeans, but this fabric tends to stretch out a bit too much for someone who wants a slim-fitting pair of jeans. They're awesome otherwise, but I'll probably be shopping in the petite sizes from Prana from now on!
review.name: Love the colors, wish it fit better!

review.reviewBody: Disappointed because they run small & didn't fit, but fabric was soft & felt like they would've been comfortable to wear.
review.name: Run small

review.reviewBody: Loved these when I got them. Wore them twice and they started coming apart on the corners of both back pockets. So bummed...
review.name: They let me down.

review.reviewBody: First jeans I've found that fit nicely in the hips/thigh but don't cut into the waist. Love the colors, I ended up buying two. Comfortable and cute. They do seem to attract cat fur, maybe after several washes this will go away. Favorite jeans hands down.
review.name: Love love love these jeans!!

The strap placement is awkward, almost under the heel as opposed to under the ball of the foot. Strains very long and still comes loose.

review.reviewBody: My sister and I went backpacking and I couldn't be more pleased with how my new OR Helium Gaiters worked.  No rocks in my shoes, no dust, and we climbed up a glacier and they kept me dry.  I wanted something lightweight and protected my shoes and lower legs and these definitely fit the bill - wore them 4 days in a row.  Easy on and off and fit me well.  Also I wanted the red upper part because so many of my things are black and get lost in the bottom of my pack.  These are easy to find.
review.name: OR Women's Helium Gaiters

review.reviewBody: I’m using these for all of my hikes and snowshoeing. My calves are nice and warm, and my feet are dry! I always thought my calves were big, but they still fit really well. My calves are 14 inches at the west part. These are easy on and off and super light if you are carrying them in your pack.
review.name: Fantastic gaiters

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and water/snow proof to extend my hiking season.
review.name: Gaiters are great

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and thin. Great at shedding water and snow. Stay away from thorns.

review.reviewBody: The quality and fabric seems very good, I havent had a chance to try wear them yet.
review.name: Women's Gaiters

review.reviewBody: Product itself is fine. But the sizing chart, which uses shoe size, does not work. I'm a women's size 10 1/2 and there was NOW WAY the size L/XL would fit my calves. There was a ONE INCH GAP at the widest part of the calf and the gaiters would just not close. To be honest, I laughed. Why does XL and XXL exist for men and not for women? I had to get men's size L and even then, the fit was quite snug (I also tried on men's Crocodile gaiters and couldn't even fit in size L). Here's a suggestion : make unisex gaiters (no men's and women's models) based on a size chart that uses calf circumference and not shoe size :)
review.name: Sizing chart does not work - big calves beware

review.reviewBody: I bought these for a West Coast Trail hike. One snap broke within the 7 days. But Outdoor Research was quick to send a new set and no expense. They have great gear. This was lightweight and fit true to size.
review.name: Great Gaiters

review.reviewBody: These gaiters seem nice, but the calves are just slightly too small.   I can almost get them velcroed at the widest point, but not quite.  For reference my calves are 16" around; I'm 5'6" and usually wear a women's size 8 or medium.  I thought these would fit me because I previously tried their wide calf gaiters (the Outdoor Research Crocodile Gaiters - women's L Wide) and they were way too big, as in falling off my legs.  Nothing here for mid-sized women I guess.
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The helium gaiter does exactly what it is intended to do; they are packable and lightweight. I have not torn the material yet, but I do not push these gaiters through brush because I think they might tear easily. They hold up well to a light rain and are very easy to put on. One tip for fit: I wear a size 8.5 US women's boot and size down to get a good fit from these gaiters if you do not have a larger circumference leg.
review.name: Lightweight gaiter for packing away

name: Helium Gaiters - Women's

review.reviewBody: Love the quality, color and feel but not true to size.  I wear 36 to maybe 38 in some of the big brands but their brand size 36 is huge.  I would have sent back if I didn't already wear them for the day.  I sent all the unworn pants back for the same issue.  I'll just get a 34 or 35 if possible next time.
review.name: Great Quality But

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing these for the last few weeks and love the versatility of them. Great for hiking, boating or on the golf course. The fabric is amazing from a performance standpoint but looks clean and can be dressed up. The drawcord is a great add and makes for the perfect fit while on a long hike. Love the color selection and will definitely be adding a few more.
review.name: Great multiuse summer short

name: Tahoe Hybrid Walkshort - Men's

review.reviewBody:
this is not a running review (i am not a runner)- i bought these looking for a design-oriented , tech-infused urban-use boot for everyday wear. i asked nnormal if the lugs would get excessive wear on concrete surfaces, i was told they would be fine.

i think they perform admirably for this usage - they are very light, supportive, well cushioned w/o feeling "floaty", they don't feel massive like some other sneaker boots i have tried (terrex/etc..) - the outsole has great grip on slippery concrete, and the waterproofing has done a great job in some pretty intense downpours. 

4/5 for me - not sure what i would change about it - i wish there were some reflective aspects/etc, but it wasn't designed with street use in mind. they could easily pivot this model to streetwear, but that might compromise some of the performance aspects... as-is, highly recommended.
review.name: nnormal tomir as everyday urban boot

name: Tomir Mid WP Shoe

hasVariant.name: Gripsaver Plus
hasVariant.description: Buy the Metolius Gripsaver Plus online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this to help strengthen my grip and improve hand flexibility after badly breaking my elbow. It sounds strange, but the elbow (now with a plate and screws) has recovered faster than my hand after being in a cast and brace for two months. The Gripsaver is easy to use and using it daily has made a marked difference in my grip strength. My hand is still below par, but I can finally feel it getting stronger.
review.name: Great for Rehab

review.reviewBody: For someone who sits on a computer, this is a good exercise tool.  It is small, fits in my backpack and brief case.  I can pull in out on the commute back and forth or in the office.  I have had mine for over 5 years and it has lasted a long time.  I recommend it.  As it is for my hands and more therapeutic than load bearing exercise, to keep my hands balanced, I do a lot of reps at a time, until my had is tired, then swap.
review.name: Good Product - Works as Advertised

review.reviewBody: Practically zero resistance both ways.  Total waste of money if you are stronger than average.  Get a donut for less than half the price.  It?s junk.
review.name: Total junk; Get a donut instead

name: Gripsaver Plus
